trans-unit.source: Update Job Collection (Scheduler API)
trans-unit.target: Update Job Collection (Scheduler API)

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Collection</languageKeyword> request updates an existing job collection.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Collection</languageKeyword> request updates an existing job collection.

trans-unit.source: This request is also used to start or stop a job collection.
trans-unit.target: This request is also used to start or stop a job collection.

trans-unit.source: Stopping a job collection has the side effect of disabling all child jobs.
trans-unit.target: Stopping a job collection has the side effect of disabling all child jobs.

trans-unit.source: When a job collection that was stopped is restarted, all jobs that were previously enabled (before the job collection was stopped) are re-enabled.
trans-unit.target: When a job collection that was stopped is restarted, all jobs that were previously enabled (before the job collection was stopped) are re-enabled.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Collection</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Job Collection</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloud-service-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your cloud service ID, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-collection-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the ID of the job collection you’d like to update.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloud-service-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your cloud service ID, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-collection-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the ID of the job collection you’d like to update.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: PUT
trans-unit.target: PUT

trans-unit.source: PATCH
trans-unit.target: PATCH

trans-unit.source: Use for starting or stopping all jobs in a job collection: <codeInline>https://management.core.windows.net/%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;/cloudServices/%%amp;lt;cloud-service-id%%amp;gt;/resources/scheduler/jobCollections/%%amp;lt;job-collection-id%%amp;gt;/jobs</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Use for starting or stopping all jobs in a job collection: <codeInline>https://management.core.windows.net/%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;/cloudServices/%%amp;lt;cloud-service-id%%amp;gt;/resources/scheduler/jobCollections/%%amp;lt;job-collection-id%%amp;gt;/jobs</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2013-06-01</userInput> or a later version.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2013-06-01</userInput> or a later version.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The content type of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The content type of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag matches the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag matches the value specified.

trans-unit.source: If an Etag value is passed for this header for the update operation, Azure matches the value with the Etag for the resource
trans-unit.target: If an Etag value is passed for this header for the update operation, Azure matches the value with the Etag for the resource

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The format of the request body is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>InstrincSettings</languageKeyword> element is optional, but allows you to specify quotas and settings at the job collection level, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>InstrincSettings</languageKeyword> element is optional, but allows you to specify quotas and settings at the job collection level, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Plan</languageKeyword> may be <languageKeyword>Free</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Standard</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Plan</languageKeyword> may be <languageKeyword>Free</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Standard</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>MaxJobCount</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>MaxRecurrence</languageKeyword> control the maximum job count in the collection and the maximum recurrence of the collection respectively.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>MaxJobCount</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>MaxRecurrence</languageKeyword> control the maximum job count in the collection and the maximum recurrence of the collection respectively.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to use a similar operation to start or stop a job collection indirectly -- you do this by sending a PATCH request to all jobs in a job collection, to set them to disabled or enabled.
trans-unit.target: It is possible to use a similar operation to start or stop a job collection indirectly -- you do this by sending a PATCH request to all jobs in a job collection, to set them to disabled or enabled.

trans-unit.source: To indirectly start a job collection, set the ‘state’ of every job in the job collection to <languageKeyword>enabled</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To indirectly start a job collection, set the ‘state’ of every job in the job collection to <languageKeyword>enabled</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: To indirectly stop a job collection, set the ‘state’ to <languageKeyword>disabled</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To indirectly stop a job collection, set the ‘state’ to <languageKeyword>disabled</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.target: For an asynchronous operation, you can call get operation status with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.
